Metaphor:QUANTITY IS VERTICALITY

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss QUANTITY IS VERTICALITY
Name Transcription
Aliases

QUANTITY IS VERTICALITY

MORE IS UP (Metaphors We Live By,15-16)

QUANTITY IS VERTICAL ELEVATION (Grady (1998))

Description
Comments Commonly referred to by one of its entailed metaphors, MORE IS UP.
Tags orientational
Family Scalar Metaphors, Grady Primary Metaphors, Orientational Metaphors
Metaphor Level
Metaphor Type Primary
Experiential Basis If you add more of a substance or of physical objects to a container or pile, the level goes up.
Cultural Scope universal
Source Frame Verticality
Roles:scalar_position, vertical_entity, verticality_scale, vertical_axis
Target Frame Quantity
Roles:quantity_scale, measure_of_quantity, entity_amount, entity


Mappings:

quantity_scale <= verticality_scale
measure_of_quantity <= scalar_position

Related Metaphors:

Current Metaphor QUANTITY IS VERTICALITY
Relation Type makes use of
Related Metaphor CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION
Description Increase and decrease of quantity is upwards and downwards movement.

Entailments:

Target Entailment greater quantities
Source Inference Higher point(s) along a vertical scale
Type of Inferential Structure aligned scales
Entailed Metaphor(s) MORE IS UP
Target Entailment lesser quantities
Source Inference Lower point(s) along a vertical scale
Type of Inferential Structure aligned scales
Entailed Metaphor(s) LESS IS DOWN

Examples:

Example Text: The number of books printed each year keeps going up.
Transcription:
English Translation:
Provenance: Metaphors We Live By (15)
Annotation:
Comments:
Example Text: His income fell last year.
Transcription:
English Translation:
Provenance: Metaphors We Live By (15-16)
Annotation:
Comments:

Last reviewed by Ellen, Oana
Status in development
